pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:0.5: 60. The training rule on what is growing on the lower part of the body
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.2: a certain nun was alone with a man, when she had him rupture an abscess growing on the lower part of her body.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.3: When he tried to rape her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.5: The nuns came rushing to and asked her why.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.7: And she told them what had happened.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.8: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.9: “How could a nun be alone with a man and have him rupture an abscess growing on the lower part of her body?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.10: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.15: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.16.1: ‘If a nun, alone with a man, without getting permission from the Sangha or a group, has an abscess or a wound situated on the lower part of her body ruptured by him, or split open, washed, anointed, bandaged, or unwrapped by him, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.5: The lower part of the body:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.6: below the navel and above the knees.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.16: the Sangha of nuns is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.18: several nuns is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.20: a human male, not a male spirit, not a male ghost, not a male animal. He understands and is capable of raping.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.24: just the man and the nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.25: If she tells him, “Rupture it,” she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.26: When it has been ruptured, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.27: If she tells him, “Split it open,” she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.28: When it has been split open, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.29: If she tells him, “Wash it,” she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.30: When it has been washed, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.31: If she tells him, “Anoint it,” she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.32: When it has been anointed, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.33: If she tells him, “Bandage it,” she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.34: When it has been bandaged, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.35: If she tells him, “Unwrap it,” she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.36: When it has been unwrapped, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.2.2: if she gets permission and then has it ruptured, split open, washed, anointed, bandaged, or unwrapped;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.2.3: if she has a female companion who understands;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.2.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.2.6: The tenth training rule is finished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.2.7: The sixth sub-chapter on monasteries is finished.
